greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Perfect squares n^2 which are not the sum of two primes (otherwise 0).
comment: For odd n, n^2 is odd so the two primes must be opposite in parity. Lesser prime must be 2 and greater prime must be n^2-2. Thus for odd n, n^2 is the sum of two primes iff n^2-2 is prime. - _Ray Chandler_, May 12 2005
example: a(11)=11^2=121, which is impossible to obtain summing two primes.
results.author: _Alexandre Wajnberg_, May 08 2005
